sen.j: 京丹後市（きょうたんごし）は京都府の市。
sen.e: Kyotango City is a city of Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyotango City is a city of Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyotango City is a city of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 京都府中郡 (京都府)峰山町、大宮町、竹野郡網野町、丹後町、弥栄町、熊野郡久美浜町が、2004年4月1日の市制施行により市町村合併して誕生した。
sen.e: This city was established due to the municipal merger based on the establishment of a municipal system: Mineyama Omiya -chos of Naka County, Amino, Tango and Yasaka -chos of Takeno County, and Mihama -cho of Kumano County were merged.

This city was established due to the municipal merger based on the establishment of a municipal system: Mineyama and Omiya -chos of Naka County, Amino, Tango and Yasaka -chos of Takeno County, and Mihama-cho of Kumano County were merged.
sen.cmt: スペース消去、Mineyama Omiya -chos→Mineyama and Omiya -chosとしました。
sen.e: This city was established due to the municipal merger based on the establishment of a municipal system: Mineyama and Omiya -chos of Naka County, Amino, Tango and Yasaka -chos of Takeno County, and Mihama-cho of Kumano County were merged.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 発足時の人口は約6万7000人で、旧峰山町役場に市役所が置かれたほか、その他の5つの旧町役場は、それぞれ市役所庁舎となった。
sen.e: When Kyotango City was established, its population was approximately 67,000 and the city hall was established in the old Mineyama -cho hall and the other former -cho halls were changed into Kyotango City office buildings.

When Kyotango City was established, its population was approximately 67,000 and the city hall was established in the old Mineyama-cho town hall and the other five former town halls were changed into Kyotango City office buildings.
sen.cmt: スペース消去、Mineyama -cho hall→Mineyama-cho town hall、the other former -cho halls→the other five former town hallsとしました。
sen.e: When Kyotango City was established, its population was approximately 67,000 and the city hall was established in the old Mineyama-cho town hall and the other five former town halls were changed into Kyotango City office buildings.

sen.j: 京都府の最北部に位置している。
sen.e: The city is located in the northmost area of Kyoto Prefecture.
The city is located in the northmost area of Kyoto Prefecture.
The city is located in the northmost area of Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 市域を北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線が走っているが、市名「京丹後」が付けられた駅名は無く、存在するのは各町名の駅名である。
sen.e: Although Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR) runs through the city, there is no station with the city name 'Kyotango,' but there are stations with the -cho names before the merger.

Although Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR) runs through the city, there is no station with the city name 'Kyotango,' but there are stations with the -cho (town) names before the merger.

Although Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line of Kitakinki Tango Railway Corporation (KTR) runs through the city, there is no station with the city name 'Kyotango,' but there are stations with the -cho (town) names before the merger.

sen.j: 京丹後市全てがかつての久美浜県の一部である。
sen.e: The whole area of Kyotango City is a pat of Kumihama Prefecture, which used to exist.
The whole area of Kyotango City is a part of Kumihama Prefecture, which used to exist.
The whole area of Kyotango City is a part of Kumihama Prefecture, which used to exist.

sen.j: 市制により、中郡、竹野郡、熊野郡は消滅したが、旧町名は大字として住所表記に残された。
sen.e: Although Nakano, Takeno County, and Kumano County disappeared according to the municipal organization, the old town names have remained as 'Oaza' in addresses.
Although Naka County, Takeno County, and Kumano County disappeared according to the municipal organization, the old town names have remained as 'Oaza' in addresses.
Although Naka County, Takeno County, and Kumano County disappeared according to the municipal organization, the old town names have remained as 'Oaza' in addresses.

sen.j: - 京極高知が築いた宮津藩の伝統を伝える峰山藩のあった地として知られる。
sen.e: This town is known as the place where the Mineyama Domain existed, which inherited the tradition of the Miyazu Domain, which was established by Takatomo KYOGOKU.
sen.cmt: 以前から生じていることですが、最初にハイフォンがあると、処理に問題が生じますのでハイフォンは省いております。以下同様
sen.e: This town is known as the place where the Mineyama Domain existed, which inherited the tradition of the Miyazu Domain, which was established by Takatomo KYOGOKU.
This town is known as the place where the Mineyama Domain existed, which inherited the tradition of the Miyazu Domain, which was established by Takatomo KYOGOKU.

sen.j: 丹後半島の中心に位置し、『天女の羽衣伝説』で知られる町。
sen.e: This town is located in the center of Tango Peninsula and is famous for "Tennyo-no-hagoromo densetsu (Legend of the celestial raiment [robe] of an angel)."
This town is located in the center of Tango Peninsula and is famous for "Tennyo no hagoromo densetsu" (Legend of the celestial raiment [robe] of an angel).
sen.cmt: Tennyo no hagoromo densetsuとし、クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: This town is located in the center of Tango Peninsula and is famous for "Tennyo no hagoromo densetsu" (Legend of the celestial raiment [robe] of an angel).

sen.j: - 小野小町の伝説で有名。
sen.e: This town is famous for the legend of ONO no Komachi.
This town is famous for the legend of ONO no Komachi.
This town is famous for the legend of ONO no Komachi.

sen.j: - 日本海に面し、鳴き砂の浜である琴引浜などの海水浴場と、丹後ちりめんの生産で知られる。
sen.e: This town faces Japan Sea, and is famous for swimming beaches including Kotobiki-hama beach, a singing-sand beach, and Tango Chirimen (silk crepe).
This town faces Japan Sea, and is famous for swimming beaches including Kotobiki-hama beach, a singing-sand beach, and Tango Chirimen (silk crepe).
This town faces Japan Sea, and is famous for swimming beaches including Kotobiki-hama beach, a singing-sand beach, and Tango Chirimen (silk crepe).

sen.j: - 兵庫県との県境に位置し、日本海に面した町で町内では温泉も湧いている。
sen.e: This town, located on the border between Kyoto and Hyogo Prefectures, faces Japan Sea and has some hot springs.
This town, located on the border between Kyoto and Hyogo Prefectures, faces Japan Sea and has some hot springs.
This town, located on the border between Kyoto and Hyogo Prefectures, faces Japan Sea and has some hot springs.

sen.j: 豊岡市との県をまたいだ合併話も出た事がある。
sen.e: There used to be a cross-prefecture merger plan between Kumihama and Toyooka City.
There used to be a cross-prefecture merger plan between Kumihama and Toyooka City.
There used to be a cross-prefecture merger plan between Kumihama and Toyooka City.

sen.j: - 近畿地方最北端の「経ヶ岬」とそこに立つ灯台がある。
sen.e: This town has Kyoga-misaki. the northmost point of Kinki District and a lighthouse standing on the point.
This town has Kyoga-misaki, the northmost point of the Kinki region and a lighthouse standing on the point.
sen.cmt: 文中のピリオド→カンマに修正、Kinki District→the Kinki regionに修正
sen.e: This town has Kyoga-misaki, the northmost point of the Kinki region and a lighthouse standing on the point.

sen.j: また、難読地名としても知られる「間人（たいざ）」は「間人ガニ」で知られる。
sen.e: Taiza,' which is famous as a place difficult to read, is famous for 'Taiza Crab.'
Taiza,' which is famous as a place difficult to read, is famous for 'Taiza Crab.'

sen.j: - 丹後半島のほぼ中央に位置し、細川忠興の妻・細川ガラシャ幽閉の地。
sen.e: This town is located in almost the center of Tango Peninsula and famous as a place where Hosokawa Garasha, Mrs. Sansai Hosokawa, was confined.
This town is located in almost the center of Tango Peninsula and famous as a place where Garasha HOSOKAWA, Mrs. Tadaoki HOSOKAWA, was confined.
sen.cmt: Hosokawa Garasha→Garasha HOSOKAWA、Sansai Hosokawa→Tadaoki HOSOKAWAに修正
sen.e: This town is located in almost the center of Tango Peninsula and famous as a place where Garasha HOSOKAWA, Mrs. Tadaoki HOSOKAWA, was confined.

sen.j: 京丹後市内最大の病院である「京丹後市立弥栄病院」（旧：弥栄町国民健康保険病院）がある。
sen.e: This town has the lagest hospital in Kyotango city, 'Kyotango City Yasaka Hospital (former: Yasaka-cho National Health Insurance Hospital).
This town has the lagest hospital in Kyotango City, 'Kyotango City Yasaka Hospital' (former: Yasaka-cho National Health Insurance Hospital).
sen.cmt: 余分なスペース消去、Kyotango Cityに修正、クォーテーションの片方を補足
sen.e: This town has the lagest hospital in Kyotango City, 'Kyotango City Yasaka Hospital' (former: Yasaka-cho National Health Insurance Hospital).

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 日本海に面する市域一帯には、峰山町に扇谷遺跡、途中ケ岡遺跡、弥栄町に奈具遺跡など弥生時代の大遺跡があり、日本海側における文化の一大中心地であったと見られる。
sen.e: Since the following large remains of the Yayoi Period were found in the area facing Japan sea, the area is considered to have been a cultural center on the Japan Sea side : Ogitani Remains and Tochugaoka Remains in Mineyama town, and Nagu Remains of Yasaka town.

Since the following large remains of the Yayoi period were found in the area facing Japan Sea, the area is considered to have been a cultural center on the Japan Sea side: Ogitani Remains and Tochugaoka Remains in Mineyama-cho, and Nagu Remains of Yasaka-cho.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更、Japan Sea、Mineyama-cho、Yasaka-choとし、余分なスペース消去
sen.e: Since the following large remains of the Yayoi period were found in the area facing Japan Sea, the area is considered to have been a cultural center on the Japan Sea side: Ogitani Remains and Tochugaoka Remains in Mineyama-cho, and Nagu Remains of Yasaka-cho.

sen.j: 古墳時代の4世紀中頃には、網野町に日本海側最大の前方後円墳である網野銚子山古墳（全長198メートル）、丹後町に神明山古墳（全長190メートル）が築かれた。
sen.e: Around the middle of the fourth century, in the Kofun period (tumulus period), the largest keyhole-shaped tomb mound on the Japan Sea side, Aminochoshiyama Burial Mound (198 meter in entire length) was established in Amino town and Shinmeiyama Burial Mound (190 meter in entire length) in Tango town.

Around the middle of the fourth century, in the Kofun period (tumulus period), the largest keyhole-shaped tomb mound on the Japan Sea side, Aminochoshiyama-kofun Tumulus (198 meter in entire length) was established in Amino-cho and Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus (190 meter in entire length) in Tango-cho.

Around the middle of the fourth century, in the Kofun period (tumulus period), the largest keyhole-shaped tomb mound on the Japan Sea side, Aminochoshiyama-kofun Tumulus (198 meter in entire length) was established in Amino-cho and Shinmeiyama-kofun Tumulus (190 meter in entire length) in Tango-cho.

sen.j: 当時は独自の王国があったとの説もある（→丹後王国を参照）。
sen.e: There is a theory that this area had an independent kingdom in those days. (Refer to 'Tango Kingdom'.)
There is a theory that this area had an independent kingdom in those days (refer to 'Tango Kingdom').
sen.cmt: ピリオド修正、Refer→referとしました。
sen.e: There is a theory that this area had an independent kingdom in those days (refer to 'Tango Kingdom').

sen.j: 峰山町丹波は8世紀始めには丹波国丹波郡丹波里といわれたところで、丹波国の中心地であったと見られる。
sen.e: Mineyama-cho, Tanba was called Tanba-sato, Tanba-gun, Tanba Province in the beginning of the eighth century, and is thought to have been the center of Tanba Province.
Tanba, Mineyama-cho was called Tanba-sato, Tanba County, Tanba Province in the beginning of the eighth century, and is thought to have been the center of Tanba Province.
sen.cmt: Mineyama-cho, Tanba→Tanba, Mineyama-cho、Tanba-gun→Tanba Countyとしました。
sen.e: Tanba, Mineyama-cho was called Tanba-sato, Tanba County, Tanba Province in the beginning of the eighth century, and is thought to have been the center of Tanba Province.

sen.j: その後、713年に丹後国が分置され、丹後国となった。
sen.e: In 713, that area was divided into Tanba and Tango, and Mineyama-cho belonged to Tango Province.
In 713, that area was divided into Tanba and Tango, and Mineyama-cho belonged to Tango Province.
In 713, that area was divided into Tanba and Tango, and Mineyama-cho belonged to Tango Province.

sen.j: 主要な延喜式内社としては多久神社（峰山町丹波）、大宮売神社（大宮町周枳）、竹野神社（丹後町宮）、奈具神社（弥栄町舟木）、網野神社（網野町網野）などが鎮座する。
sen.e: Major 'Engishikinaisha' included Taku-jinja Shrine (Mineyama-cho, Tanba), Omiyame-jinja Shrine (Omiya-cho, Suki), Nagu-jinja Shrine (Yasaka-cho, Funaki) and Amino-jinja Shrine (Amino-cho, Amino).
sen.cmt: 延喜式内社の定訳が見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: Major 'Engishikinaisha' (shrines listed in Engishiki laws) included Taku-jinja Shrine (Tanba, Mineyama-cho), Omiyame-jinja Shrine (Suki, Omiya-cho), Takeno-jinja Shrine (Miya, Tango-cho), Nagu-jinja Shrine (Funaki, Yasaka-cho) and Amino-jinja Shrine (Amino, Amino-cho).
sen.cmt: 「竹野神社（丹後町宮）」→訳漏れのため訳出、Engishikinaishaの補足追加、Tanba, Mineyama-cho、Suki, Omiya-cho、Funaki, Yasaka-cho、Amino, Amino-choの順としました。
sen.e: Major 'Engishikinaisha' (shrines listed in Engishiki laws) included Taku-jinja Shrine (Tanba, Mineyama-cho), Omiyame-jinja Shrine (Suki, Omiya-cho), Takeno-jinja Shrine (Miya, Tango-cho), Nagu-jinja Shrine (Funaki, Yasaka-cho) and Amino-jinja Shrine (Amino, Amino-cho).

sen.j: 関ヶ原の戦いの功績により丹後全域が京極高知の領国（丹後藩）となった。
sen.e: Because of Takatomo KYOGOKU's great achievement in the Battle of Sekigahara, the entire area of Tango was given to Takatomo (the Tango Domain).
Because of Takatomo KYOGOKU's great achievement in the Battle of Sekigahara, the entire area of Tango was given to Takatomo (the Tango Domain).
Because of Takatomo KYOGOKU's great achievement in the Battle of Sekigahara, the entire area of Tango was given to Takatomo (the Tango Domain).

sen.j: その後、高知の三子により3藩に別れ（丹後三分割）、峰山には京極高通 (丹後国峰山藩主)により峰山藩が置かれる。
sen.e: Afterwards, the domain was divided into three and one-third was given to each of Takatomo's sons (Tango trifurcation) and in Mineyama, the Mineyama Domain was established by Takamichi KYOGOKU (the lord of the Mineyama Domain of Tango Province).
sen.cmt: 丹後三分割の定訳が見つかりませんでした。
sen.e: Afterwards, the domain was divided into three and one-third was given to each of Takatomo's sons (Tango trifurcation) and in Mineyama, the Mineyama Domain was established by Takamichi KYOGOKU (the lord of the Mineyama Domain of Tango Province).

Afterwards, the domain was divided into three and one-third was given to each of Takatomo's sons (Tango trifurcation) and in Mineyama, the Mineyama Domain was established by Takamichi KYOGOKU (the lord of the Mineyama Domain of Tango Province).

sen.j: 宮津藩京極家は改易、丹後田辺藩京極家は但馬へ転封となる中、峰山藩京極家は丹後の所領を幕末まで守り通し、京極高知の丹後藩の伝統を伝える存在として知られた。
sen.e: While the Kyogoku clan of the Miyazu Domain was punished by being deprived of their fief and the Kyogoku clan of the Tanabe Domain of Tango Province was transferred to Tajima, the Kyogoku clan of the Mineyama Domain kept their territory until the end of the Edo period, and passed down the tradition of the Tango Domain established by Takatomo KYOGOKU.

While the Kyogoku clan of the Miyazu Domain was punished by being deprived of their fief and the Kyogoku clan of the Tanabe Domain of Tango Province was transferred to Tajima, the Kyogoku clan of the Mineyama Domain kept their territory until the end of the Edo period, and passed down the tradition of the Tango Domain established by Takatomo KYOGOKU.

While the Kyogoku clan of the Miyazu Domain was punished by being deprived of their fief and the Kyogoku clan of the Tanabe Domain of Tango Province was transferred to Tajima, the Kyogoku clan of the Mineyama Domain kept their territory until the end of the Edo period, and passed down the tradition of the Tango Domain established by Takatomo KYOGOKU.

sen.j: また、峰山藩京極家からは幾人もの若年寄が出て、江戸幕府の中枢で活躍した。
sen.e: The Kyogoku clan of the Mineyama Domain produced a lot of 'wakadoshiyori (a managerial position in Edo bakufu)' and they worked actively in the inner circle of the government.
The Kyogoku clan of the Mineyama Domain produced a lot of 'wakadoshiyori' (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) and they worked actively in the inner circle of the government.
sen.cmt: クオーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: The Kyogoku clan of the Mineyama Domain produced a lot of 'wakadoshiyori' (a managerial position in Edo bakufu) and they worked actively in the inner circle of the government.

sen.j: 現在の久美浜町には久美浜代官が置かれ、山陰地方の天領を統轄した。
sen.e: Kumihama local magistrate office was placed in the present Kumihama town, and controlled 'tenryo (bakufu-owned land)' in Sanin region.
Kumihama local magistrate office was placed in the present Kumihama-cho, and controlled 'tenryo' (bakufu-owned land) in the Sanin region.
sen.cmt: Kumihama-cho、in the Sanin regionとし、クォーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: Kumihama local magistrate office was placed in the present Kumihama-cho, and controlled 'tenryo' (bakufu-owned land) in the Sanin region.

sen.j: のち、幕末から明治の一時期には久美浜県が設置され、県庁が同代官所跡に置かれたこともある。
sen.e: Kumihama Prefecture was established for a short time, from the end of the Edo period to the beginning of the Meiji period, and its prefectural government office was placed in the remain of Kumihama local magistrate office.

Kumihama Prefecture was established for a short time, from the end of the Edo period to the beginning of the Meiji period, and its prefectural government office was placed in the remains of Kumihama local magistrate office.

Kumihama Prefecture was established for a short time, from the end of the Edo period to the beginning of the Meiji period, and its prefectural government office was placed in the remains of Kumihama local magistrate office.

sen.j: 江戸時代中期には京都の西陣織を参考にした「丹後織」が峰山藩で生まれ、以後丹後ちりめんなどがこの地の名産となり現在にいたっている。
sen.e: In the middle of the Edo period, 'Tango brocade,' which followed the idea of 'Nishijin brocade' of Kyoto, was produced and since then fabrics including 'Tango chirimen (silk crepe)' have been special local products of the area.

In the middle of the Edo period, 'Tango brocade,' which followed the idea of 'Nishijin brocade' of Kyoto, was produced and since then fabrics including 'Tango chirimen' (silk crepe) have been special local products of the area.
sen.cmt: クオーテーションの位置を移動
sen.e: In the middle of the Edo period, 'Tango brocade,' which followed the idea of 'Nishijin brocade' of Kyoto, was produced and since then fabrics including 'Tango chirimen' (silk crepe) have been special local products of the area.

sen.j: 1927年3月、北丹後地震に襲われ壊滅的な被害を出した。
sen.e: In March 1927, the earthquake at the northern Tango Province occurred, causing catastrophic damage.
In March 1927, the earthquake at the northern Tango Province occurred, causing catastrophic damage.
In March 1927, the earthquake at the northern Tango Province occurred, causing catastrophic damage.

sen.e: On April 1, 2004,-establishment of a municipal system.

sen.cmt: 統一リストの表記に修正

sen.j: 市名の由来
sen.e: The origin of the city's name
The origin of the city's name
The origin of the city's name

sen.j: 旧丹後国より。
sen.e: By the former Tango Province.
By the former Tango Province.
By the former Tango Province.

sen.j: 日本の市町村の廃置分合平成の大合併において、京都府内では既存の市名との重複を避ける為もあって「京」を冠するところが多かった。
sen.e: In the great merger of municipalities in the Heisei period, many cities crowned 'Kyo' in their names in order to avoid overlap from exsiting cities
sen.cmt: 「日本の市町村の廃置分合」は「平成の大合併」とほぼ同意と考え、訳しておりません。一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In the great merger of municipalities in the Heisei period, many cities crowned 'Kyo' in their names in order to avoid overlap from exsiting cities.
In the great merger of municipalities in the Heisei period, many cities crowned 'Kyo' in their names in order to avoid overlap from exsiting cities.

sen.j: が、当市の場合は合併する自治体の中に「丹後町」があったため、他町への配慮からか重複がないにもかかわらず「京」を冠している。
sen.e: When this city was established due to the merger, it included 'Tango town' and it seems that the people in charge wanted to be considerate to other towns; that was why the city named itself 'Kyotango city' although there was no overlapping. (One year later, in 2005, Kyotanba city was established because of the same reason.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: When this city was established due to the merger, it included 'Tango-cho' and it seems that the people in charge wanted to be considerate to other towns; that was why the city named itself 'Kyotango City' although there was no overlapping. (One year later, in 2005, Kyotanba City was established because of the same reason.)
sen.cmt: Tango-cho、Kyotango City、Kyotanba Cityとし、余分なスペース消去
sen.e: When this city was established due to the merger, it included 'Tango-cho' and it seems that the people in charge wanted to be considerate to other towns; that was why the city named itself 'Kyotango City' although there was no overlapping.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: （同じような理由で1年後の2005年に京丹波町が誕生している）
sen.e: (One year later, in 2005, Kyotanba City was established because of the same reason.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理

sen.j: 一般的に都市名の重複を避ける等のために冠される側になる旧国名が、冠する側になった珍しい例である。
sen.e: They are rare examples that the former province's name was capped; usually the former province's name is used to avoid overlapping.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: They are rare examples that the former province's name was capped; usually the former province's name is used to avoid overlapping.
They are rare examples that the former province's name was capped; usually the former province's name is used to avoid overlapping.

sen.j: 京（京都）が元は都市名であることを考えると、逆転現象と言える。
sen.e: These two can be called inversion phenomena in considering Kyo (Kyoto) was originally a city name.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処 また、この箇所の日本文の意味が不明です。
sen.e: These two can be called inversion phenomena in considering Kyo (Kyoto) was originally a city name.

sen.j: バス
sen.e: Bus
Bus
Bus

sen.j: 市内全域を、丹後海陸交通（丹海バス・本社：京都府与謝野町）が担当している。
sen.e: Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd. (Tankai Bus, the central ofice:Yosano-cho, Kyoto Prefecture) was in charge of the entire city.
Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd. (Tankai Bus, the central ofice: Yosano-cho, Kyoto Prefecture) was in charge of the entire city.
Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd. (Tankai Bus, the central ofice: Yosano-cho, Kyoto Prefecture) was in charge of the entire city.

sen.j: また、弥栄町や大宮町・久美浜町には市営バスが運行されている。
sen.e: City buses run in Yasaka-cho, Omiya-cho and Kumihama-cho.
City buses run in Yasaka-cho, Omiya-cho and Kumihama-cho.
City buses run in Yasaka-cho, Omiya-cho and Kumihama-cho.

sen.j: 2006年10月1日より、丹後海陸交通との協働により、実証実験として市内の一部地域にて「上限200円バス」を運行したところ好評であった。
sen.e: The "bus with a cap fare of 200 yen"in cooperation with Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd started to run on a trial basis on October 1, 2006, it was highly evaluated.
The 'bus with a cap fare of 200 yen' in cooperation with Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd started to run on a trial basis on October 1, 2006, and it was highly evaluated.
sen.cmt: シングルクォーテーションに変更、スペース追加、and追加NC_Check
sen.e: The '200-yen fare cap bus' in cooperation with Tango Kairiku Kotsu Co., Ltd started to run on a trial basis on October 1, 2006, and it was highly evaluated.
sen.cmt: bus with a cap fare of 200 yen→200-yen fare cap bus

sen.j: このことから、2007年10月1日より丹海バスの上限200円の運行エリアを市内全域に拡大したほか、市営バスでも上限200円としての運行となった。
sen.e: Because of that success, the "Tankai bus with a cap fare of 200 yen" has been introduced into the entire city since October 1, 2007 and the city bus runs with a cap fare of 200 yen.
Because of that success, the "Tankai bus with a cap fare of 200 yen" has been introduced into the entire city since October 1, 2007 and the city bus runs with a cap fare of 200 yen.
Because of that success, the Tankai bus with the 200-yen fare cap has been introduced into the entire city since October 1, 2007 and the city bus also started to run with the 200-yen fare cap.
sen.cmt: 「市営バスでも」のでもの部分が訳漏れだったので対応しました。with a cap fare of 200 yen→with the 200-yen fare cap
